intro: Helmia bulbifera, commonly known as the bulbous helmet, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive helmet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, rounded bulbs beneath its leaves, which can be used for propagation. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in woodland habitats. Its blooming period typically occurs in late spring to early summer.
